programme.title: UFC Fight Night
programme.desc: Josh Emmett (19-4-0) goes up against Lerone Murphy (15-0-1) in the featherweight main event; Pat Sabatini (19-5) faces Joanderson Brito (17-4-1) in a featherweight bout; Cortavious Romious (9-3) vs. ChangHo Lee (10-1) in a bantamweight bout.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Oscar Piastri secured his first win of 2025 with his victory at China over Lando Norris, who leads four-time defending champion Max Verstappen by eight points; Verstappen won the last three races at Japan after averaging 161.271 kph last year.

programme.title: The Bird and Taurasi Show
programme.desc: Defending national champion South Carolina (35-3) seeks its third title in the last four years; UConn (36-3) blew out UCLA, 85-51, to advance to its 13th title game and defeated the Gamecocks, 87-58, on Feb. 16 behind 28 points from Azzi Fudd.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Miles Mikolas (0-0, 3.38) of St. Louis allowed two hits over 5.1 innings against the Angels; Sean Newcombe (0-1, 9.00) allowed eight hits in four innings at Baltimore in his last start for the Red Sox.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Houston (0-1) dropped its opener to St. Louis, 31-6, managing only 170 yards of offense, but defeated the Renegades last season, 17-9; Arlington (1-0) blew out San Antonio, 33-9, behind 110 rushing yards and a touchdown from Kalen Ballage.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: A preview of the upcoming Major League Baseball game with expert analysis, insightful observations and exclusive interviews; coverage includes highlights of Major League Baseball games and the latest baseball news with knowledgeable commentary.

programme.desc: The worldwide leader in sports covers all the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: The GameDay crew goes on the road to various locations at different campuses across the country and discusses the biggest games of the week, while evaluating player performances; experts weigh in on trending topics and teams throughout the nation.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Vegas won the first two season meetings with Vancouver after a 3-1 victory on Feb. 22 behind goals from three different players, including Tomas Hertl, and 33 saves from Adin Hill; Jake DeBrusk scored the lone goal for the Canucks in the loss.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The most remarkable sports stories are featured, as storytellers break away from the traditional view of a sports film and showcasing stories of passion, triumph, loss and resurgence of athletes, as featured guests share their side of the story.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Toronto is 22-12-3 on the road, and defeated the Panthers, 3-2, on April 2 behind a goal and an assist from Mitch Marner and Matthew Knies after losing the previous three meetings with the Panthers; Florida is 24-11-2 at home this season.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The worldwide leader in sports covers all the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.desc: The worldwide leader in sports covers all the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Duke claimed a 3-0 sweep against North Carolina in their lone series of the 2024 season, winning the final matchup on Apr. 7 with a 6-1 scoreline; Claire Davidson posted a game-leading 4 RBIs for the Blue Devils in the win at home.

programme.title: Gr8tness
programme.desc: A record once thought to be untouchable, Alex Ovechkin gives an all-access look as he chases the 894 goals of the legendary Wayne Gretzky, showing how he prepares for his games and the pressure he is facing to break the prestigious record.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: UFC Countdown
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at fighter training camps as they prepare for their marquee matchups on pay-per-view or other televised events to show how they train for the fight, and interviews with the fighters give a look inside the fighter's mind.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Despite losing to NC State in the 1983 NCAA Tournament final, Houston's Phi Slama Jama team, helmed by head coach Guy V. Lewis, was a legendary squad with the likes of Hakeem Olajuwon and Clyde Drexler leading the Cougars to deep tournament runs.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Christian Laettner used his brash and boisterous personality mixed with his on-court skills to become one of the most despised college basketball athletes in the history of the sport, as the documentary focuses on why he garnered those sentiments.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Texas entered the series having claimed an 11-1 victory over Missouri in their most recent meeting from the 2023 season behind 3 runs scored by Leighann Goode; four different players had 2 RBIs for the Longhorns in the win at the neutral site.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: Behind captain Mark Messier and goalie Mark Richter, the New York Rangers were in prime position in 1994 to give the team their first Stanley Cup title since 1940, using inspiration from paralyzed NYPD officer Steven McDonald to make their run.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Dave Gavitt, a former basketball coach at Providence, was the driving force behind the creation of the Big East Conference in 1979, which flourished in the 1980s and became one of the most highly respected basketball conferences in the country.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1983, North Carolina State suffered 10 losses in the regular season and had to overcome national powerhouses to win the ACC Tournament and qualify for the NCAA Tournament, where the Wolfpack mounted a memorable run to the national championship.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: Alex Gibney explores the fans' need to place the blame for difficult losses, as he examines the foul ball knocked from Moises Alou's hands by Steve Bartman and the ground ball that rolled through Bill Buckner's legs in the 1986 World Series.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Texas A&M's Myles Patton (2-3, 3.82) has struck out 40 batters and allowed just seven walks over 37.2 innings in seven starts; top-ranked Tennessee, which has split the 24 all-time series vs. the Aggies, has a .317 team batting average in 2025.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The worldwide leader in sports covers all the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: The Draft: Featured
programme.desc: Interesting stories surrounding the NFL Draft featuring the contributions some of the players make on the field, along with off the field, giving an all-access look as they prepare for the draft and get ready for the next step of their lives.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Arizona's Smith Bailey (1-1, 3.13) allowed four runs on eight hits over 4.1 innings for a no-decision in an 11-6 win over Baylor on March 30; No. 24-ranked Arizona State's Jaden Alba (1-0, 4.82) has allowed a .324 batting average in five starts.

programme.title: Professional Fighters League
programme.desc: Top fighters from around the world engage in a full-contact combat sport that allows a wide variety of fighting methods and skills from Mixed Martial Arts traditions as the fighters look to move up the rankings and stake claim to championship gold.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: The story of the 1985 Mississippi State Bulldogs team and how they failed to win the College World Series is retold, including the complicated relationship between Will Clark and Rafael Palmeiro and an exploration of what the players accomplished.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: Malik Nabers, Terrion Arnold, Laiatu Latu and Chop Robinson give an all-access look as they get ready for the 2024 NFL Draft, showing the training they go through, the gym workouts and their Combine, along with their time away from the sport.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The event helps tip off college basketball's Final Four weekend, as some of the top collegiate three-point shooters and dunkers compete against each other to showcase their skills; Steven Ashworth and Christian Shumate are among the players.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The worldwide leader in sports covers all the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: UFC Countdown
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at fighter training camps as they prepare for their marquee matchups on pay-per-view or other televised events to show how they train for the fight, and interviews with the fighters give a look inside the fighter's mind.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: Cameras follow the newest members of the NFL as they go through the draft, preseason, training camp, numerous hazing rituals instigated by veteran players, and an assortment of other situations that will test each rookie's mettle.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.title: Equestrian
programme.desc: Equestrian is the only sport staged in the Olympic Games that involves animals, and it is one of the few sports where men and women compete head-to-head; equestrian includes: dressage, jumping and eventing as both rider and horse are challenged.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Mel Kiper Jr. reveals the fourth edition of his mock 2025 NFL Draft, going over the changes he made from his third mock, the players that are rising and falling on his board, along with the best fits for teams looking to address needs.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: From 1990-1993, the Buffalo Bills were known as much for their talent as their fighting in the locker room, but the team managed to come together to make a series of memorable Super Bowl runs that all ended in disappointment.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Roki Sasaki (0-0, 5.79) has worked 4.2 innings over two starts for the Dodgers; Aaron Nola (0-1, 8.44) had eight strikeouts in his last start for the Phillies.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Roki Sasaki (0-0, 5.79) has worked 4.2 innings over two starts for the Dodgers; Aaron Nola (0-1, 8.44) had eight strikeouts in his last start for the Phillies.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Nebraska (19-14) defeated Georgetown, 81-69, to advance behind 28 points from Brice Williams and 17 from Juwan Gary; Boise State (26-10) erupted on offense to beat Butler, 100-93, behind 27 points from Javan Buchanan and 21 from Tyson Degenhart.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Denny Hamlin secured his first Cup Series win of 2025 and 55th of his career with a victory at Martinsville over Christopher Bell; Brad Keselowski and Chase Briscoe won the two races at Darlington last year over Ty Gibbs and Kyle Busch.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in fifth event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Dean Burmester won the individual crown with a playoff triumph over Sergio Garcia, while Legion XIII took home the team title with a one-shot victory in last year's edition.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending XFL Conference champion San Antonio (0-1) dropped its opener to Arlington, 33-9; St. Louis (1-0) opened with a 31-6 win over Houston behind two touchdowns from Manny Wilkins, and won both meetings with the Brahmas last season.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: UCF (19-16) used a strong second half to beat Cincinnati, 88-80, to advance behind 31 points and seven assists from Darius Johnson; Villanova (21-14) came back to beat USC, 60-59, behind 28 points from the country's leading scorer Eric Dixon.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The event pushes the world's top players to their physical limits as they race to throw as many strikes as possible in a two-minute window; 2024 champion Jesper Svensson, EJ Tackett, Jason Belmonte, Kris Prather and Ryan Barnes headline the field.

programme.title: MLB on FS1 Postgame
programme.desc: Analysts recap the recent game with highlights and interviews with players and managers, along with looking around the rest of the MLB to update games in progress and show highlights of the completed games to cover the day's action.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Day
programme.desc: RaceDay previews the Goodyear 400 and Denny Hamlin, who secured his first win of the season with his victory at Martinsville over Christopher Bell, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Denny Hamlin secured his first Cup Series win of 2025 and 55th of his career with a victory at Martinsville over Christopher Bell; Brad Keselowski and Chase Briscoe won the two races at Darlington last year over Ty Gibbs and Kyle Busch.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending XFL Conference champion San Antonio (0-1) dropped its opener to Arlington, 33-9; St. Louis (1-0) opened with a 31-6 win over Houston behind two touchdowns from Manny Wilkins, and won both meetings with the Brahmas last season.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: College basketball action.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in fifth event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Dean Burmester won the individual crown with a playoff triumph over Sergio Garcia, while Legion XIII took home the team title with a one-shot victory in last year's edition.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Denny Hamlin secured his first Cup Series win of 2025 and 55th of his career with a victory at Martinsville over Christopher Bell; Brad Keselowski and Chase Briscoe won the two races at Darlington last year over Ty Gibbs and Kyle Busch.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending XFL Conference champion San Antonio (0-1) dropped its opener to Arlington, 33-9; St. Louis (1-0) opened with a 31-6 win over Houston behind two touchdowns from Manny Wilkins, and won both meetings with the Brahmas last season.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The event pushes the world's top players to their physical limits as they race to throw as many strikes as possible in a two-minute window; 2024 champion Jesper Svensson, EJ Tackett, Jason Belmonte, Kris Prather and Ryan Barnes headline the field.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending XFL Conference champion San Antonio (0-1) dropped its opener to Arlington, 33-9; St. Louis (1-0) opened with a 31-6 win over Houston behind two touchdowns from Manny Wilkins, and won both meetings with the Brahmas last season.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in fifth event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Dean Burmester won the individual crown with a playoff triumph over Sergio Garcia, while Legion XIII took home the team title with a one-shot victory in last year's edition.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Nebraska (19-14) defeated Georgetown, 81-69, to advance behind 28 points from Brice Williams and 17 from Juwan Gary; Boise State (26-10) erupted on offense to beat Butler, 100-93, behind 27 points from Javan Buchanan and 21 from Tyson Degenhart.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in fifth event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Dean Burmester won the individual crown with a playoff triumph over Sergio Garcia, while Legion XIII took home the team title with a one-shot victory in last year's edition.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending champion Birmingham (0-1) dropped its opener to DC, 18-11, but won both meetings with the Panthers last season; Michigan (1-0) opened with a 26-12 win over Memphis behind a passing and rushing touchdown from Blake Perkins.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending champion Birmingham (0-1) dropped its opener to DC, 18-11, but won both meetings with the Panthers last season; Michigan (1-0) opened with a 26-12 win over Memphis behind a passing and rushing touchdown from Blake Perkins.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Portland (3-2-1) is 6-1-1 in the eight previous encounters after securing a 1-0 triumph on March 1, as David Costa found the back of the net in the 89th minute; Austin (4-2-0) has won three in a row after defeating St. Louis City, 1-0, on March 30.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: Pacific and Valour split victories in their four meetings from the 2024 season with Valour claiming a 1-0 win in the final matchup on Sept. 30; Pacific's Kevin Ceceri scored an own-goal in the 77th minute of play for the lone goal of the loss.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: St. Kilda (2-1-0) seeks third-straight win after blasting Richmond, 135-53, on March 29; Port Adelaide (1-2-0) has won 14 of the 15 previous meetings, including a 62-60 triumph last season in Round 16, as Aliir Aliir had 22 disposals and 10 marks.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: York United was undefeated against Vancouver in four meetings from the 2024 season, claiming wins in their first and final matchups with 3-0 and 1-0 scorelines; Nyal Higgins found the net for the lone goal of the 1-0 victory on Sept. 6.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The clash of styles that has defined the modern game and divided bowling fandom takes center stage; EJ Tackett leads a team of traditional one-handed players against two-handed pioneer Jason Belmonte and his squad of revolutionaries.

programme.desc: Nebraska/Boise State winner goes up against the UCF/Villanova winner in the championship game on the inaugural tournament, which awards the winner of the 16-team tournament a $300,000 NIL prize and $100,000 in NIL to the runner-up.

programme.title: Women's International Friendlies
programme.desc: Argentina played Chile to a scoreless draw in a friendly matchup on Feb. 25; Canada has won each of the five all-time meetings with La Albiceleste across all competitions, including a 2-0 triumph at Estadio El Palmar in Cádiz, Spain on Oct. 6, 2022.

programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.
